null.verse 30:44: Hij die verwerpt, zijn ongeloof zal tegen hem zijn, en zij die goede daden verrichten, bereiden dit voor hun eigen ziel.
null.verse 30:45: Opdat Hij hen, die geloven en goede werken doen, moge belonen uit Zijn overvloed.
null.verse 30:46: En één onder Zijn tekenen is dat Hij de winden met blijde vooruitzichten zendt, opdat Hij u Zijn genade moge doen smaken, en opdat de schepen op Zijn gebod mogen varen, opdat gij moogt zoeken naar Zijn overvloed en opdat gij dankbaar zult zijn.
null.verse 30:47: Waarlijk, Wij zonden boodschappers vóór u naar hun volkeren.
null.verse 30:48: Hij is God, Die de winden zendt welke de wolken doen oprijzen.
null.verse 30:49: Ofschoon zij voordien, voordat hij (de regen) over hen was nedergezonden, vertwijfelden.
null.verse 30:50: Beschouw daarom de kentekenen van God’s barmhartigheid: hoe Hij de aarde doet herleven na haar dood.
null.verse 30:51: En indien Wij een (droge) wind hadden gezonden en zij de aarde zagen geel worden, zouden zij daarna zeker ondankbaarheid hebben betoond.
null.verse 30:52: En gij kunt de doden niet doen horen, noch kunt gij de doven de roep doen horen wanneer zij u hun rug toekeren,
null.verse 30:53: Noch kunt gij de blinden uit hun dwaling leiden.
null.verse 30:54: Het is God, Die u in een staat van zwakheid schept, dan na de zwakte kracht geeft en na de kracht (weer) zwakte en ouderdom.
null.verse 30:55: De Dag waarop het Uur zal komen zullen de schuldigen zweren, dat zij slechts een uur hebben geleefd - zo werden zij bedrogen.
null.verse 30:56: Maar zij wie wijsheid en geloof was gegeven, zullen zeggen: "Volgens het Boek van God zijt gij inderdaad tot de Dag der Opstanding gebleven.
null.verse 30:57: Daarom zullen de uitvluchten op die Dag de onrechtvaardigen niet baten; noch zal hun verontschuldiging worden aangenomen.
null.verse 30:58: Waarlijk, Wij hebben in deze Koran allerlei gelijkenissen voor de mensen gegeven; voorzeker, als gij hun een teken brengt, zullen de ongelovigen zeggen: "Gij zijt slechts leugenaars.
null.verse 30:59: Zo verzegelt God het hart van hen, die niet willen weten.
null.verse 30:60: Wees geduldig voorzeker, de Belofte van God is waar; en laat hen die geen zekerheid hebben u niet doen wankelen.

Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 30:3: In the nearer land, and they, after their defeat will be victorious
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 30:4: Within ten years - Allah’s is the command in the former case and in the latter - and in that day believers will rejoice
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 30:6: It is a promise of Allah.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 30:7: They know only some appearance of the life of the world, and are heedless of the Hereafter.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 30:8: Have they not pondered upon themselves ? Allah created not the heavens and the earth, and that which is between them, save with truth and for a destined end.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 30:9: Have they not travelled in the land and seen the nature of the consequence for those who were before them ? They were stronger than these in power, and they dug the earth and built upon it more than these have built.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 30:10: Then evil was the consequence to those who dealt in evil, because they denied the revelations of Allah and made a mock of them.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 30:11: Allah produceth creation, then He reproduceth it, then unto Him ye will be returned.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 30:12: And in the day when the Hour riseth the unrighteous will despair.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 30:13: There will be none to intercede for them of those whom they made equal with Allah.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 30:14: In the day when the Hour cometh, in that day they will be sundered.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 30:15: As for those who believed and did good works, they will be made happy in a Garden.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 30:16: But as for those who disbelieved and denied Our revelations, and denied the meeting of the Hereafter, such will be brought to doom.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 30:17: So glory be to Allah when ye enter the night and when ye enter the morning -
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 30:18: Unto Him be praise in the heavens and the earth! - and at the sun’s decline and in the noonday.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 30:19: He bringeth forth the living from the dead, and He bringeth forth the dead from the living, and He reviveth the earth after her death.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 30:20: And of His signs is this: He created you of dust, and behold you human beings, ranging widely!
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 30:21: And of His signs is this: He created for you helpmeets from yourselves that ye might find rest in them, and He ordained between you love and mercy.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 30:22: And of His signs is the creation of the heavens and the earth, and the difference of your languages and colours.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 30:23: And of His signs is your slumber by night and by day, and your seeking of His bounty.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 30:24: And of His signs is this: He showeth you the lightning for a fear and for a hope, and sendeth down water from the sky, and thereby quickeneth the earth after her death.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 30:25: And of His signs is this: The heavens and the earth stand fast by His command, and afterward, when He calleth you, lo! from the earth ye will emerge.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 30:26: Unto Him belongeth whosoever is in the heavens and the earth.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 30:27: He it is Who produceth creation, then reproduceth it, and it is easier for Him.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 30:28: He coineth for you a similitude of yourselves.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 30:29: Nay, but those who do wrong follow their own lusts without knowledge.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 30:30: So set thy purpose (O Muhammad) for religion as a man by nature upright - the nature (framed) of Allah, in which He hath created man.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 30:31: Turning unto Him (only); and be careful of your duty unto Him and establish worship, and be not of those who ascribe partners (unto Him);
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 30:32: Of those who split up their religion and became schismatics, each sect exulting in its tenets.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 30:33: And when harm toucheth men they cry unto their Lord, turning to Him in repentance; then, when they have tasted of His mercy, behold! some of them attribute partners to their Lord
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 30:34: So as to disbelieve in that which We have given them.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 30:35: Or have We revealed unto them any warrant which speaketh of that which they associate with Him ?
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 30:36: And when We cause mankind to taste of mercy they rejoice therein; but if an evil thing befall them as the consequence of their own deeds, lo! they are in despair!
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 30:37: See they not that Allah enlargeth the provision for whom He will, and straiteneth (it for whom He will).
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 30:38: So give to the kinsman his due, and to the needy, and to the wayfarer.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 30:39: That which ye give in usury in order that it may increase on (other) people’s property hath no increase with Allah; but that which ye give in charity, seeking Allah’s Countenance, hath increase manifold.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 30:40: Allah is He Who created you and then sustained you, then causeth you to die, then giveth life to you again.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 30:41: Corruption doth appear on land and sea because of (the evil) which men’s hands have done, that He may make them taste a part of that which they have done, in order that they may return.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 30:42: Say (O Muhammad, to the disbelievers): Travel in the land, and see the nature of the consequence for those who were before you! Most of them were idolaters.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 30:43: So set thy purpose resolutely for the right religion, before the inevitable day cometh from Allah.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 30:44: Whoso disbelieveth must (then) bear the consequences of his disbelief, while those who do right make provision for themselves -
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 30:45: That He may reward out of His bounty those who believe and do good works.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 30:46: And of His signs is this: He sendeth herald winds to make you taste His mercy, and that the ships may sail at His command, and that ye may seek his favour, and that haply ye may be thankful.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 30:47: Verily We sent before thee (Muhammad) messengers to their own folk.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 30:48: Allah is He Who sendeth the winds so that they raise clouds, and spreadeth them along the sky as pleaseth Him, and causeth them to break and thou seest the rain downpouring from within them.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 30:49: Though before that, even before it was sent down upon them, they were in despair.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 30:50: Look, therefore, at the prints of Allah’s mercy (in creation): how He quickeneth the earth after her death.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 30:51: And if We sent a wind and they beheld it yellow, they verily would still continue in their disbelief.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 30:52: For verily thou (Muhammad) canst not make the dead to hear, nor canst thou make the deaf to hear the call when they have turned to flee.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 30:53: Nor canst thou guide the blind out of their error.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 30:54: Allah is He Who shaped you out of weakness, then appointed after weakness strength, then, after strength, appointed weakness and grey hair.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 30:55: And on the day when the Hour riseth the guilty will vow that they did tarry but an hour - thus were they ever deceived.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 30:56: But those to whom knowledge and faith are given will say: The truth is, ye have tarried, by Allah’s decree, until the Day of Resurrection.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 30:57: In that day their excuses will not profit those who did injustice, nor will they be allowed to make amends.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 30:58: Verily We have coined for mankind in this Qur’an all kinds of similitudes; and indeed if thou camest unto them with a miracle, those who disbelieve would verily exclaim: Ye are but tricksters!
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 30:59: Thus doth Allah seal the hearts of those who know not.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 30:60: So have patience (O Muhammad)! Allah’s promise is the very truth, and let not those who have no certainty make thee impatient.

Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 30:2: The Roman Empire has been defeated-
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 30:3: In a land close by; but they, (even) after (this) defeat of theirs, will soon be victorious-
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 30:7: They know but the outer (things) in the life of this world: but of the End of things they are heedless.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 30:8: Do they not reflect in their own minds? Not but for just ends and for a term appointed, did God create the heavens and the earth, and all between them: yet are there truly many among men who deny the meeting with their Lord (at the Resurrection)!
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 30:9: Do they not travel through the earth, and see what was the end of those before them? They were superior to them in strength: they tilled the soil and populated it in greater numbers than these have done: there came to them their apostles with Clear (Signs).
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 30:10: In the long run evil in the extreme will be the End of those who do evil; for that they rejected the Signs of God, and held them up to ridicule.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 30:11: It is God Who begins (the process of) creation; then repeats it; then shall ye be brought back to Him.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 30:12: On the Day that the Hour will be established, the guilty will be struck dumb with despair.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 30:13: No intercessor will they have among their "Partners" and they will (themselves) reject their "Partners".
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 30:14: On the Day that the Hour will be established,- that Day shall (all men) be sorted out.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 30:15: Then those who have believed and worked righteous deeds, shall be made happy in a Mead of Delight.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 30:16: And those who have rejected Faith and falsely denied our Signs and the meeting of the Hereafter,- such shall be brought forth to Punishment.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 30:17: So (give) glory to God, when ye reach eventide and when ye rise in the morning;
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 30:18: Yea, to Him be praise, in the heavens and on earth; and in the late afternoon and when the day begins to decline.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 30:19: It is He Who brings out the living from the dead, and brings out the dead from the living, and Who gives life to the earth after it is dead: and thus shall ye be brought out (from the dead).
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 30:20: Among His Signs in this, that He created you from dust; and then,- behold, ye are men scattered (far and wide)!
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 30:21: And among His Signs is this, that He created for you mates from among yourselves, that ye may dwell in tranquillity with them, and He has put love and mercy between your (hearts): verily in that are Signs for those who reflect.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 30:22: And among His Signs is the creation of the heavens and the earth, and the variations in your languages and your colours: verily in that are Signs for those who know.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 30:23: And among His Signs is the sleep that ye take by night and by day, and the quest that ye (make for livelihood) out of His Bounty: verily in that are signs for those who hearken.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 30:24: And among His Signs, He shows you the lightning, by way both of fear and of hope, and He sends down rain from the sky and with it gives life to the earth after it is dead: verily in that are Signs for those who are wise.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 30:25: And among His Signs is this, that heaven and earth stand by His Command: then when He calls you, by a single call, from the earth, behold, ye (straightway) come forth.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 30:26: To Him belongs every being that is in the heavens and on earth: all are devoutly obedient to Him.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 30:27: It is He Who begins (the process of) creation; then repeats it; and for Him it is most easy.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 30:28: He does propound to you a similitude from your own (experience): do ye have partners among those whom your right hands possess, to share as equals in the wealth We have bestowed on you? Do ye fear them as ye fear each other? Thus do we explain the Signs in detail to a people that understand.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 30:29: Nay, the wrong-doers (merely) follow their own lusts, being devoid of knowledge.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 30:30: So set thou thy face steadily and truly to the Faith: (establish) God’s handiwork according to the pattern on which He has made mankind: no change (let there be) in the work (wrought) by God: that is the standard Religion: but most among mankind understand not.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 30:31: Turn ye back in repentance to Him, and fear Him: establish regular prayers, and be not ye among those who join gods with God,-
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 30:32: Those who split up their Religion, and become (mere) Sects,- each party rejoicing in that which is with itself!
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 30:33: When trouble touches men, they cry to their Lord, turning back to Him in repentance: but when He gives them a taste of Mercy as from Himself, behold, some of them pay part-worship to other god’s besides their Lord,-
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 30:34: (As if) to show their ingratitude for the (favours) We have bestowed on them! Then enjoy (your brief day); but soon will ye know (your folly).
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 30:35: Or have We sent down authority to them, which points out to them the things to which they pay part-worship?
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 30:36: When We give men a taste of Mercy, they exult thereat: and when some evil afflicts them because of what their (own) hands have sent forth, behold, they are in despair!
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 30:37: See they not that God enlarges the provision and restricts it, to whomsoever He pleases? Verily in that are Signs for those who believe.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 30:38: So give what is due to kindred, the needy, and the wayfarer.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 30:39: That which ye lay out for increase through the property of (other) people, will have no increase with God: but that which ye lay out for charity, seeking the Countenance of God, (will increase): it is these who will get a recompense multiplied.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 30:40: It is God Who has created you: further, He has provided for your sustenance; then He will cause you to die; and again He will give you life.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 30:41: Mischief has appeared on land and sea because of (the meed) that the hands of men have earned, that (God) may give them a taste of some of their deeds: in order that they may turn back (from Evil).
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 30:42: Say: "Travel through the earth and see what was the end of those before (you): Most of them worshipped others besides God.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 30:43: But set thou thy face to the right Religion before there come from God the Day which there is no chance of averting: on that Day shall men be divided (in two).
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 30:44: Those who reject Faith will suffer from that rejection: and those who work righteousness will spread their couch (of repose) for themselves (in heaven):
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 30:45: That He may reward those who believe and work righteous deeds, out of his Bounty.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 30:46: Among His Signs is this, that He sends the Winds, as heralds of Glad Tidings, giving you a taste of His (Grace and) Mercy,- that the ships may sail (majestically) by His Command and that ye may seek of His Bounty: in order that ye may be grateful.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 30:47: We did indeed send, before thee, apostles to their (respective) peoples, and they came to them with Clear Signs: then, to those who transgressed, We meted out Retribution: and it was due from Us to aid those who believed.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 30:48: It is God Who sends the Winds, and they raise the Clouds: then does He spread them in the sky as He wills, and break them into fragments, until thou seest rain-drops issue from the midst thereof: then when He has made them reach such of his servants as He wills behold, they do rejoice!-
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 30:49: Even though, before they received (the rain) - just before this - they were dumb with despair!
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 30:50: Then contemplate (O man!) the memorials of God’s Mercy!- how He gives life to the earth after its death: verily the same will give life to the men who are dead: for He has power over all things.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 30:51: And if We (but) send a Wind from which they see (their tilth) turn yellow,- behold, they become, thereafter, Ungrateful (Unbelievers)!
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 30:52: So verily thou canst not make the dead to hear, nor canst thou make the deaf to hear the call, when they show their backs and turn away.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 30:53: Nor canst thou lead back the blind from their straying: only those wilt thou make to hear, who believe in Our signs and submit (their wills in Islam).
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 30:54: It is God Who created you in a state of (helpless) weakness, then gave (you) strength after weakness, then, after strength, gave (you weakness and a hoary head: He creates as He wills, and it is He Who has all knowledge and power.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 30:55: On the Day that the Hour (of Reckoning) will be established, the transgressors will swear that they tarried not but an hour: thus were they used to being deluded!
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 30:56: But those endued with knowledge and faith will say: "Indeed ye did tarry, within God’s Decree, to the Day of Resurrection, and this is the Day of Resurrection: but ye - ye were not aware!"
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 30:57: So on that Day no excuse of theirs will avail the transgressors, nor will they be invited (then) to seek grace (by repentance).
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 30:58: verily We have propounded for men, in this Qur’an every kind of Parable: But if thou bring to them any Sign, the Unbelievers are sure to say, "Ye do nothing but talk vanities.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 30:59: Thus does God seal up the hearts of those who understand not.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 30:60: So patiently persevere: for verily the promise of God is true: nor let those shake thy firmness, who have (themselves) no certainty of faith.

Arthur J. Arberry.verse 30:3: in the nearer part of the land; and, after their vanquishing, they shall be the victors
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 30:5: in God’s help; God helps whomsoever He will; and He is the All-mighty, the All-compassionate.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 30:6: The promise of God! God fails not His promise, but most men do not know it.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 30:7: They know an outward part of the present life, but of the Hereafter they are heedless.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 30:8: What, have they not considered within themselves? God created not the heavens and the earth, and what between them is, save with the truth and a stated term; yet most men disbelieve in the encounter with their Lord.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 30:9: What, have they not journeyed in the land and beheld how was the end of those before them? They were stronger than themselves in might, and they ploughed up the earth and cultivated it more than they themselves have cultivated it; and their Messengers came to them with the clear signs; and God would never wrong them, but themselves they wronged.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 30:10: Then the end of those that did evil was evil, for that they cried lies to the signs of God and mocked at them.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 30:11: God originates creation, then brings it back again, then unto Him you shall be returned.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 30:12: Upon the day when the Hour is come, the sinners shall be confounded
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 30:13: no intercessors shall they have amongst their associates, and they shall disbelieve in their associates.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 30:14: Upon the day when the Hour is come, that day they shall be divided;
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 30:15: as for those who believed, and did deeds of righteousness, they shall walk with joy in a green meadow,
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 30:16: but as for those who disbelieved, and cried lies to Our signs and the encounter of the Hereafter, they shall be arraigned into the chastisement.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 30:17: So glory be to God both in your evening hour and in your morning hour.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 30:18: His is the praise in the heavens and earth, alike at the setting sun and in your noontide hour.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 30:19: He brings forth the living from the dead, and brings forth the dead from the living, and He revives the earth after it is dead; even so you shall be brought forth.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 30:20: And of His signs is that He created you of dust; then lo, you are mortals, all scattered abroad.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 30:21: And of His signs is that He created for you, of yourselves, spouses, that you might repose in them, and He has set between you love and mercy.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 30:22: And of His signs is the creation of the heavens and earth and the variety of your tongues and hues.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 30:23: And of His signs is your slumbering by night and day, and your seeking after His bounty.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 30:24: And of His signs He shows you lightning, for fear and hope, and that He sends down out of heaven water and He revives the earth after it is dead.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 30:25: And of His signs is that the heaven and earth stand firm by His command; then, when He calls you once and suddenly, out of the earth, lo you shall come forth.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 30:26: To Him belongs whosoever is in the heavens and the earth; all obey His will.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 30:27: And it is He who originates creation, then brings it back again, and it is very easy for Him.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 30:28: He has struck for you a similitude from yourselves; do you have, among that your right hands own, associates in what We have provided for you so that you are equal in regard to it, you fearing them as you fear each other? So We distinguish the signs for a people who understand.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 30:29: Nay, but the evildoers follow their own caprices, without knowledge; so who shall guide those whom God has led astray? They have no helpers.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 30:30: So set thy face to the religion, a man of pure faith -- God’s original upon which He originated mankind.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 30:32: even of those who have divided up their religion, and become sects, each several party rejoicing in what is theirs.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 30:33: When some affliction visits mankind, they call unto their Lord, turning to Him; then, when He lets them taste mercy from Him, lo, a party of them assign associates to their Lord,
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 30:34: that they may be ungrateful for what We have given them.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 30:35: Or have We sent down any authority upon them, such as speaks of that they associate with Him?
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 30:36: And when We let men taste mercy, they rejoice in it; but if some evil befalls them for that their own hands have forwarded, behold, they despair.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 30:37: Have they not seen that God outspreads and straitens His provision to whom He will? Surely in that are signs for a people who believe.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 30:38: And give the kinsman his right, and the needy, and the traveller; that is better for those who desire God’s Face; those they are the prosperers.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 30:39: And what you give in usury, that it may increase upon the people’s wealth, increases not with God; but what you give in alms, desiring God’s Face, those -- they receive recompense manifold.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 30:40: God is He that created you, then He provided for you, then He shall make you dead, then He shall give you life; is there any of your associates does aught of that? Glory be to Him! High be He exalted above that they associate!
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 30:41: Corruption has appeared in the land and sea, for that men’s own hands have earned, that He may let them taste some part of that which they have done, that haply so they may return.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 30:42: Say: ’Journey in the land, then behold how was the end of those that were before; most of them were idolaters.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 30:43: So set thy face to the true religion before there comes a day from God that cannot be turned back; on that day they shall be sundered apart.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 30:44: Whoso disbelieves, his unbelief shall be charged against him; and whosoever does righteousness for themselves they are making provision,
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 30:45: that He may recompense those who believe and do righteous deeds of His bounty; He loves not the unbelievers.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 30:46: And of His signs is that He looses the winds, bearing good tidings and that He may let you taste of His mercy, and that the ships may run at His commandment, and that you may seek His bounty; haply so you will be thankful.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 30:47: Indeed, We sent before thee Messengers unto their people, and they brought them the clear signs; then We took vengeance upon those who sinned; and it was ever a duty incumbent upon Us, to help the believers.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 30:48: God is He that looses the winds, that stir up clouds; and He spreads them in heaven how He will, and shatters them; then thou seest the rain issuing out of the midst of them, and when He smites with it whomsoever of His servants He will, lo, they rejoice,
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 30:49: although before it was sent down on them before that they had been in despair.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 30:50: So behold the marks of God’s mercy, how He quickens the earth after it was dead; surely He is the quickener of the dead, and He is powerful over everything.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 30:51: But if We loose a wind, and they see it growing yellow, they remain after that unbelievers.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 30:52: Thou shalt not make the dead to hear, neither shalt thou make the deaf to hear the call when they turn about, retreating.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 30:53: Thou shalt not guide the blind out of their error neither shalt thou make any to hear except for such as believe in Our signs, and so surrender.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 30:54: God is He that created you of weakness, then He appointed after weakness strength, then after strength He appointed weakness and grey hairs; He creates what He will, and He is the All-knowing, the All-powerful.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 30:55: Upon the day when the Hour is come, the sinners shall swear they have not tarried above an hour; so they were perverted.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 30:56: But those who have been given knowledge and faith shall say, ’You have tarried in God’s Book till the Day of the Upraising, This is the Day of the Upraising, but you did not know.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 30:57: So that day their excuses will not profit the evildoers, nor will they be suffered to make amends.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 30:58: Indeed, We have struck for the people in this Koran every manner of similitude; and if thou bringest them a sign, those who are unbelievers will certainly say, ’You do nothing but follow falsehood.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 30:59: Even so God seals the hearts of those that know not.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 30:60: So be thou patient; surely God’s promise is true; and let not those who have not sure faith make thee unsteady.

Muhammad Asad.verse 30:3: in the lands close-by; yet it is they who, notwithstanding this their defeat, shall be victorious
Muhammad Asad.verse 30:5: with God rests all power of decision, first and last.
Muhammad Asad.verse 30:7: He gives succour to whomever He wills, since He alone is almighty, a dispenser of grace.
Muhammad Asad.verse 30:10: they know but the outer surface of this world’s life, whereas of the ultimate things they are utterly unaware.
Muhammad Asad.verse 30:11: Have they never learned to think for themselves? God has not created the heavens and the earth and all that is between them without [an inner] truth and a term set [by Him]: and yet, behold, there are many people who stubbornly deny the truth that they are destined to meet their Sustainer!
Muhammad Asad.verse 30:12: Have they, then, never journeyed about the earth and beheld what happened in the end to those [deniers of the truth] who lived before their time? Greater were they in power than they are; and they left a stronger impact on the earth, and built it up even better than these [are doing]; and to them
Muhammad Asad.verse 30:13: came their apostles with all evidence of the truth: and so, [when they rejected the truth and thereupon perished,] it was not God who wronged them, but it was they who had wronged themselves.
Muhammad Asad.verse 30:14: And once again: evil is bound to be the end of those who do evil by giving the lie to God’s messages and deriding them.
Muhammad Asad.verse 30:16: in the first instance, and then brings him forth anew: and, in the end, unto Him you all will be brought back.
Muhammad Asad.verse 30:17: And when the Last Hour dawns, those who were lost in sin will be broken in spirit:
Muhammad Asad.verse 30:18: for they will have no intercessors in the beings to whom they were wont to ascribe a share in God’s divinity, seeing that [by then] they themselves will have ceased to believe in their erstwhile blasphemous fancies.
Muhammad Asad.verse 30:19: And when the Last Hour dawns – on that Day will all
Muhammad Asad.verse 30:21: as for those who attained to faith and did righteous deeds, they shall be made happy in a garden of delight;
Muhammad Asad.verse 30:22: but as for those who refused to acknowledge the truth and gave the lie to Our messages – and
Muhammad Asad.verse 30:23: to the announcement of a life to come – they will be given over to suffering.
Muhammad Asad.verse 30:24: EXTOL, then, God’s limitless glory when you enter upon the evening hours, and when you rise at morn;
Muhammad Asad.verse 30:25: and [seeing that] unto Him is due all praise in the heavens and on earth, [glorify Him] in the afternoon as well, and when you enter upon the hour of noon.
Muhammad Asad.verse 30:26: He [it is who] brings forth the living out of that which is dead, and brings forth the dead out of that which is alive, and gives life to the earth after it had been lifeless: and even thus will you be brought forth [from death to life].
Muhammad Asad.verse 30:27: And among His wonders is this: He creates you out of dust -and then, lo! you become human beings ranging far and wide!
Muhammad Asad.verse 30:28: And among His wonders is this: He creates for you mates out of your own kind, so that you might incline towards them, and He engenders love and tenderness between you: in this, behold, there are messages indeed for people who think!
Muhammad Asad.verse 30:29: And among his wonders is the creation of the heavens and the earth, and the diversity of your tongues and colours: for in this, behold, there are messages indeed for all who are possessed of
Muhammad Asad.verse 30:31: And among His wonders is your sleep, at night or in daytime, as well as your [ability to go about in] quest of some of His bounties: in this, behold, there are messages indeed for people who [are willing to] listen!
Muhammad Asad.verse 30:32: And among His wonders is this: He displays before you the lightning, giving rise to
Muhammad Asad.verse 30:33: fear and hope, and sends down water from the skies, giving life thereby to the earth after it had been lifeless: in this, behold, there are messages indeed for people who use their reason!
Muhammad Asad.verse 30:34: And among His wonders is this: the skies and the earth stand firm at His behest.
Muhammad Asad.verse 30:36: For unto Him belongs every being that is in the heavens and on earth; all things devoutly obey His will.
Muhammad Asad.verse 30:37: And He it is who creates [all life] in the first instance, and then brings it forth anew: and most easy is this for Him, since His is the essence of all that is most sublime in the heavens and on earth, and He alone is almighty, truly wise.
Muhammad Asad.verse 30:38: He propounds unto you a parable drawn from your own life: Would you [agree to] have some of those whom your right hands possess as
Muhammad Asad.verse 30:39: partners in whatever We may have bestowed upon you as sustenance, so that you [and they] would have equal shares in it, and you would fear [to make use of it without consulting] them, just as you might fear [the more powerful of] your equals? Thus clearly do We spell out these messages unto people who use their reason.
Muhammad Asad.verse 30:40: But nay – they who are bent on evildoing follow but their own desires, without having any knowledge [of the truth].
Muhammad Asad.verse 30:43: AND SO, set thy face steadfastly towards the [one ever-true] faith, turning away from all that is false, in accordance with the natural disposition which God has instilled into man:
Muhammad Asad.verse 30:44: not to allow any change to corrupt what God has thus created – this is the [purpose of the one] ever-true faith; but most people know it not.
Muhammad Asad.verse 30:45: [Turn, then, away from all that is false,] turning unto Him ;
Muhammad Asad.verse 30:46: and remain conscious of Him, and be constant in prayer, and be not among those who ascribe divinity to aught beside Him,
Muhammad Asad.verse 30:48: among those who have broken the unity of their faith and have become sects, each group delighting in but what they themselves hold [by way of tenets].
Muhammad Asad.verse 30:49: NOW [thus it is:] when affliction befalls men, they cry out unto their Sustainer, turning unto Him [for help]; but as soon as He lets them taste of His grace, lo! some of them [begin to] ascribe to other powers a share in their Sustainer’s divinity,
Muhammad Asad.verse 30:50: [as if] to prove their ingratitude for all that We have granted them! Enjoy, then, your
Muhammad Asad.verse 30:51: life: but in time you will come to know [the truth]!
Muhammad Asad.verse 30:52: Have We ever bestowed upon them from on high a divine writ which would speak [with approval] of their worshipping aught beside Us?
Muhammad Asad.verse 30:53: And [thus it is:] when we let men taste
Muhammad Asad.verse 30:54: grace, they rejoice in it; but if evil befalls them as an outcome of what their own hands have wrought – lo! they lose all hope!
Muhammad Asad.verse 30:55: Are they, then, not aware that it is God who grants abundant sustenance, or gives it in scant measure, unto whomever He wills? In this, behold, there are messages indeed for people who will believe!
Muhammad Asad.verse 30:56: Hence, give his due to the near of kin, as well as to the needy and the wayfarer; this is best for all who seek God’s countenance: for it is they, they that shall attain to a happy state!
Muhammad Asad.verse 30:58: whatever you may give out in usury so that it might increase through
Muhammad Asad.verse 30:60: no increase in the sight of God – whereas all that you give out in charity, seeking God’s countenance, [will be blessed by Him:] for it is they, they [who thus seek His countenance] that shall have their recompense multiplied!
Muhammad Asad.verse 30:61: IT IS GOD who has created you, and then has provided you with sustenance, and then will cause you to die, and then will bring you to life again.
Muhammad Asad.verse 30:62: [Since they have become oblivious of God,] corruption has appeared on land and in the sea as an outcome of what men’s hands have wrought: and so He will let them taste [the evil of] some of their doings, so that they might return [to the right path].
Muhammad Asad.verse 30:63: Say: "Go all over the earth, and behold what happened in the end to those
Muhammad Asad.verse 30:65: most of them were wont to ascribe divine qualities to things or beings other than God.
Muhammad Asad.verse 30:66: Set, then, thy face steadfastly towards the one ever-true faith, ere there come from God a Day [of reckoning – the Day] which cannot be averted.
Muhammad Asad.verse 30:67: he who has denied the truth will have to bear [the burden of] his denial, whereas all who did what is right and just will have made goodly provision for themselves,
Muhammad Asad.verse 30:68: so that He might reward, out of His bounty, those who have attained to faith and done righteous deeds.
Muhammad Asad.verse 30:69: for among His wonders is this: He sends forth [His messages as He sends forth] the winds that bear glad tidings, so that He might give you a taste of His grace [through life-giving rains], and that ships might sail at His behest, and that you might go about in quest of some of His bounties, and that you might have cause to be grateful.
Muhammad Asad.verse 30:70: And indeed, [O Muhammad, even] before thee did We send forth apostles – each one unto his own people – and they brought them all evidence of the truth: and then, [by causing the believers to triumph,] We inflicted Our retribution upon those who
Muhammad Asad.verse 30:71: did evil: for We had willed it upon Ourselves to succour the believers.
Muhammad Asad.verse 30:72: It is God who sends forth the winds [of hope], so that they raise a cloud – whereupon He spreads it over the skies as He wills, and causes it to break up so that thou seest rain issue from within it: and as soon as He causes it to fall upon whomever He wills of His servants – lo! they rejoice,
Muhammad Asad.verse 30:73: even though a short while ago,
Muhammad Asad.verse 30:74: before it was sent down upon them, they had abandoned all hope!
Muhammad Asad.verse 30:75: Behold, then, [O man,] these signs of God’s grace – how He gives life to the earth after it had been lifeless! Verily, this Selfsame
Muhammad Asad.verse 30:76: is indeed the One that can bring the dead back to life: for He has the power to will anything!
Muhammad Asad.verse 30:77: But thus it is: if We send a wind [that scorches their land], and they see it turn yellow, they begin, after that [erstwhile joy], to deny the truth [of Our almightiness and grace]!
Muhammad Asad.verse 30:78: And, verily, thou canst not make the dead hear: and [so, too,] thou canst not make the deaf [of heart] hear this call when they turn their backs [on thee] and go away,
Muhammad Asad.verse 30:79: just as thou canst not lead the blind [of heart] out of their error: none canst thou make hear [thy call] save such as [are willing to] believe in Our messages, and thus surrender themselves unto Us.
Muhammad Asad.verse 30:80: IT IS GOD who creates you [all in a state] of weakness, and then, after weakness, ordains strength [for you], and then, after [a period of] strength, ordains
Muhammad Asad.verse 30:82: [He it is who will cause you to die, and in time will resurrect you.
Muhammad Asad.verse 30:83: But those who [in their lifetime] were endowed with knowledge and faith will say: "Indeed, you have been tardy in [accepting as true] what God has revealed, [and you have waited] until the Day of Resurrection: this, then, is the Day of Resurrection: but you – you were determined not to know it!"
Muhammad Asad.verse 30:84: And so, on that Day their excuse will be of no avail to those who were bent on evildoing, nor will they be allowed to make amends.
Muhammad Asad.verse 30:85: AND, INDEED, We have propounded unto men all kinds of parables in this Qur’ān.
Muhammad Asad.verse 30:86: message, those who are bent on denying the truth are sure to say, "You are but making false claims!"
Muhammad Asad.verse 30:87: In this way does God seal the hearts of those who do not [want to] know [the truth].
Muhammad Asad.verse 30:88: Remain, then, patient in adversity: verily, God’s promise [of resurrection] is true indeed – so let not those who are devoid of all inner certainty disquiet thy mind!

Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 30:3: in the nearer land; and they, after their defeat, will triumph
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 30:6: It is a promise from Allah.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 30:7: They know something superficial of the worldly life, but of the Hereafter they are negligent.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 30:8: Did they not reflect in their own selves? Allah did not create the heavens and the earth and what is between them but with a just cause and for an appointed time.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 30:9: Have they not traveled on earth to see how was the end of those before them? They were stronger than these in power, and they had tilled the land and had made it more populous than these have made it, and their messengers had come to them with clear proofs.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 30:10: Then the end of those who did evil was evil, because they rejected the verses of Allah and used to make mockery of them.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 30:11: Allah originates the creation, then He will create it again, then to Him you are to be returned.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 30:12: On the day when the Hour (Qiyāmah : the Day of Judgement)) will take place, the guilty will be taken aback in grief and despair.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 30:13: They will have no intercessors from among their (so-called) ‘partners of Allah’, and they themselves will reject their (such) ‘partners’.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 30:14: And the day when the Hour (Qiyāmah : the Day of Judgement)) will take place-it will be on that day that they will turn into separate groups.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 30:15: Then, those who had believed and had done righteous deeds-they will be in a garden, extremely delighted.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 30:16: As for those who had disbelieved and rejected Our verses and the meeting of the Hereafter, they will be brought for punishment.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 30:17: So, proclaim Allah’s purity (from shirk) when you see the evening and when you see the morning.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 30:18: And to Him be praise in the heavens and the earth, and in the afternoon and when you enter the time of àuhr (soon after the decline of the sun towards West).
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 30:19: He brings out the living from the dead, and brings out the dead from the living, and gives life to the land after it is dead.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 30:20: It is among His signs that He has created you from dust, then soon you are human beings scattered around.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 30:21: And it is among His signs that He has created for you wives from among yourselves, so that you may find tranquility in them, and He has created love and kindness between you.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 30:22: And among His signs is the creation of the heavens and the earth and the difference of your tongues and colors.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 30:23: And among His signs is your sleep by night and day, and your search for His grace.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 30:24: And it is among His signs that He shows you the lightening which causes fear and hope, and that He sends down water from the sky, then He revives the earth with it after its death.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 30:25: And it is among His signs that the sky and the earth stand firm by His command.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 30:26: To Him belong all those in the heavens and the earth.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 30:27: It is He who originates the creation, then will create it again; and it is easier for Him.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 30:28: He (Allah) gives you an example from yourselves: Do you have, from among your slaves, any partners in the wealth that We have given to you, so as they and you are equal in it, (and) so as you fear them like you fear each other? This is how We explain the signs for a people who understand.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 30:29: But the wrongdoers have followed their desires without knowledge.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 30:30: So, set your face to the Faith uprightly, this (faith) being the nature designed by Allah on which He has created the mankind.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 30:31: (Set your face to the Faith) turning totally towards Him, and fear Him, and establish Salāh, and do not be among those who associate partners with Allah
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 30:32: - among those who split up their religion and became sects.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 30:33: When the people are visited by some affliction, they invoke their Lord with exclusive concentration on Him.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 30:34: so as to become ungrateful for what We gave to them.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 30:35: Is it that We have sent down to them any authority that speaks to them about their associating partners with Him?
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 30:36: When We give people a taste of mercy, they are happy with it, and if they are touched by an evil because of what their hands sent ahead, they are at once in despair.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 30:37: Did they not see that Allah extends provision to whomsoever He wills, and straitens (it for whomsoever He wills)? Surely in this there are signs for a people who believe.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 30:38: So give to the kinsman his right, and to the needy and the wayfarer.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 30:39: Whatever Ribā (increased amount) you give, so that it may increase in the wealth of the people, it does not increase with Allah; and whatever Zakāh you give, seeking Allah’s pleasure with it, (it is multiplied by Allah, and) it is such people who multiply (their wealth in real terms.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 30:40: Allah is the One who created you, then gave sustenance to you, then He will make you dead, then He will make you alive.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 30:41: Calamities have appeared on land and sea because of what the hands of the people have earned, so that He (Allah) makes them taste some of what they did, in order that they may return (to the right way).
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 30:42: Say, “Go about in the land, and see how was the end of those who were before.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 30:43: Then set your face to the straight Faith before the arrival of a day that will never be repulsed by Allah.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 30:44: Whoever disbelieves, his unbelief will be against him; and whoever acts righteously, then such people are paving the path for themselves,
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 30:45: so that Allah may give reward, out of His grace, to those who believed and did righteous deeds.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 30:46: And among His signs is that He sends winds giving good news (of rain), and so that He gives you a taste of His mercy, and that the ships may sail with His command, and that you may search for His grace, and you may be grateful.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 30:47: We had indeed sent before you messengers to their people.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 30:48: Allah is the One who sends the winds, so they stir up a cloud, then He spreads it in the sky however he wills, and makes it (split) into pieces.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 30:49: even though they were absolutely hopeless before it was sent down to them.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 30:50: So, look to the effects of Allah’s mercy, how He gives life to the earth after its death.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 30:51: Should We send a (harmful) wind, and they see it (the tillage) turning yellow, then they will turn ungrateful, even after all the aforesaid (bounties of Allah).
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 30:52: So, you cannot make the dead to hear, nor can you make the deaf to hear the call when they turn their backs in retreat.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 30:53: Nor are you (able) to show the right path to the blind against their straying.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 30:54: Allah is the One who created you in a state of weakness, then He created strength after weakness, then created weakness and old age after strength.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 30:55: And on the Day when the Hour (Qiyāmah : the Day of Judgement) will take place, the sinners will swear that they did not remain (in the graves) more than one hour.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 30:56: As for those who were given knowledge and belief, they will say, “You remained, according to the destiny written by Allah, up to the Day of Resurrection.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 30:57: So, on that Day, their apology will not benefit the wrongdoers, nor will they be asked to repent.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 30:58: Indeed We have given in this Qur’ān all kinds of examples for the benefit of mankind.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 30:59: Thus Allah seals up the hearts of those who do not believe.

Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 30:3: in the nearer [part of the] land.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 30:8: an outward aspect of the life of this world; but they, of the Hereafter, they are oblivious.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 30:9: Have they not contemplated themselves? God did not create the heavens and the earth, and what is between them, except with the truth and an appointed term.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 30:10: Have they not travelled in the land and beheld how was the consequence for those before them? They were more powerful than them, and they effected the land, and developed it more than these have developed it; and their messengers brought them clear signs, for God would never wrong them, but they used to wrong themselves.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 30:11: Then the consequence for those who committed evil was evil because they denied the signs of God and made a mock of them.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 30:12: God originates creation, then He will reproduce it, then to Him you shall be returned.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 30:13: And on the Day when the Hour comes, the sinners will be dumbfounded.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 30:14: And none from among those partners of theirs shall be intercessors for them and they shall disavow these partners of theirs.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 30:15: And on the Day when the Hour comes, that day they shall be separated.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 30:16: As for those who believed and performed righteous deeds, they shall be made happy in a garden [of Paradise].
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 30:17: But as for those who disbelieved and denied Our signs and the encounter of the Hereafter, those, they shall be arraigned into the chastisement.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 30:18: So glory be to God when you enter the [time of the] night and when you rise in the morning.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 30:20: praise in the heavens and the earth — and as the sun declines and when you enter noontime.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 30:21: He brings forth the living from the dead, and He brings forth the dead from the living, and He revives the earth after it has died.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 30:22: And of His signs is that He created you of dust, then lo! you are human beings, spreading.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 30:23: And of His signs is that He created for you from yourselves mates that you might find peace by their side, and He ordained between you affection and mercy.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 30:24: And of His signs is the creation of the heavens and the earth and the differences of your tongues and your colours.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 30:25: And of His signs is your sleep by night and day and your seeking of His bounty.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 30:26: And of His signs is His showing you lightning to arouse fear and hope, and He sends down water from the heaven and with it He revives the earth after it has died.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 30:27: And of His signs is that the heaven and the earth remain standing by His command; then, when He calls you [to come] out of the earth, lo! you shall come forth.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 30:28: And to Him belongs whoever is in the heavens and the earth.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 30:29: And He it is Who initiates the creation, then brings it back, and that is
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 30:31: He has struck for you a similitude from yourselves: do you have among those whom your right hands own any partners, [who may share] in what We have provided for you, so that you are equal therein, fearing them as you fear your own .
